snippet: Time Warner creates a center, complete with a faux living room, where researchers can analyze how viewers respond to shows and movies.
abstract: Amy Chozick Advertising column; Time Warner plans to open a 9,600-square-foot media lab, complete with a faux living room and 47-seat 3-D movie theater, where researchers can analyze how viewers responds to television programs and movies, an important 'real-world' view for advertisers.

snippet: The iPhone 4S was greeted with grumbling when it came out in October for lacking the razzle-dazzle of what many imagined an iPhone 5 would look like. But plenty of people snapped it up. Apple reported that its profit for the holiday quarter <a hre...
abstract: The iPhone 4S was greeted with grumbling when it came out in October for lacking the razzle-dazzle of what many imagined an iPhone 5 would look like. But plenty of people snapped it up. Apple reported that its profit for the holiday quarter more than doubled. Also see earnings reports for Yahoo and Verizon.

headline.main: Apple's Profit Doubles on Holiday iPhone 4S Sales

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes items on an argument that software piracy has some benefits for society, a musician's take on SOPA and Steve Jo...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes items on an argument that software piracy has some benefits for society, a musician's take on SOPA and Steve Jobs's vision for iPhone photography.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Steve Jobs's Photo Plan, Piracy and Public Outrage

snippet: Mitt Romney on Tuesday released documents that show he and his wife had an effective federal tax rate in 2010 of 13.9 percent.

headline.main: For Romneys, Friendly Code Reduces Taxes
headline.print_headline: For Romneys, Friendly Code Reduces Taxes

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and DAVID KOCIENIEWSKI

snippet: Though neither iPhones nor iPads existed five years ago, they account for 72 percent of Apple’s total revenue.
abstract: Apple reports that its profit for the holiday quarter more than doubled, largely on sales of the iPhone 4S.

headline.main: Apple’s Profit Doubles on Holiday iPhone 4S Sales
headline.print_headline: Apple, Aided by an iPhone Frenzy, Doubles Its Quarterly Profit

snippet: The car company's ad last year, called "The Force," was considered the most successful on a day full of high-priced commercials broken up by a football game. The company cautiously returned to a "Star Wars" theme.
abstract: The car company's ad last year, called "The Force," was considered the most successful on a day full of high-priced commercials broken up by a football game. The company cautiously returned to a "Star Wars" theme.

headline.main: Volkswagen Super Bowl Ad Has a Tough Act to Follow: Last Year's Ad

snippet: After a long, controversial wait, Mitt Romney released details of his federal tax returns on Tuesday, including information on the trusts managed by the investment bank Goldman Sachs.
abstract: After a long, controversial wait, Mitt Romney released details of his federal tax returns on Tuesday, including information on the trusts managed by the investment bank Goldman Sachs.

headline.main: Goldman Makes Money for the Romneys
